GOD.content: reader of literature hypnotized, paralyzed before suspended perplexity, before secret path of secret, exposed and concealed, jealously guarded: who says what to whom? who asks forgiveness?
GOD.linkedContent: reader of literature hypnotized, paralyzed before suspended perplexity, before secret path of secret, exposed and concealed, jealously guarded: who says what to whom? who asks forgiveness?

GOD.content: fabled reader (deciphers) vs. infinite reader (reads in the secret the avowal of literature)
GOD.linkedContent: fabled reader (deciphers) vs. infinite reader (reads in the secret the avowal of literature)

GOD.content: singularity is sealed & betrayed by inheritance that confirms, reads, translates the covenant
GOD.linkedContent: singularity is sealed & betrayed by inheritance that confirms, reads, translates the covenant

GOD.content: literature inherits from Abraham, betrays him
GOD.linkedContent: literature inherits from Abraham, betrays him

GT.content: reader is not deceived [like narrator], experiences a secret w/out depth, a secret w/out secret
GT.linkedContent: reader is not deceived [like narrator], experiences a secret w/out depth, a secret w/out secret

GT.content: readability of text structured by unreadability of secret, narrator in situation analogous to reader; crypt gives to be read, eternally unreadable
GT.linkedContent: readability of text structured by unreadability of secret, narrator in situation analogous to reader; crypt gives to be read, eternally unreadable

MONL.content: political decision in writing & reading: inscribe undecidable (chance, terror) in ipseity of host, avoid temptation to make prior-to-the-first-language a language of the master (new master)
MONL.linkedContent: political decision in writing & reading: inscribe undecidable (chance, terror) in ipseity of host, avoid temptation to make prior-to-the-first-language a language of the master (new master)

FL.content: [re: unreadable readability of law] new interpretative readings as revolutions, found something new & remain unreadable re: norms of reading > something of the general strike in every new reading [see SPOM pp. 218-219, POR p. 4]
FL.linkedContent: [re: unreadable readability of law] new interpretative readings as revolutions, found something new & remain unreadable re: norms of reading > something of the general strike in every new reading [see SPOM pp. 218-219, POR p. 4]

FL.content: Derrida hesitates to call the readability of violence Lacan’s symbolic order
FL.linkedContent: Derrida hesitates to call the readability of violence Lacan’s symbolic order

LOBL.content: decision [btwn 2 syntaxes of L’arrêt de mort] becomes unreadable, but it does not arrest reading, it starts reading, writing and translation again [desire?]
LOBL.linkedContent: decision [btwn 2 syntaxes of L’arrêt de mort] becomes unreadable, but it does not arrest reading, it starts reading, writing and translation again [desire?]

LOBL.content: temptation of exhaustive reading [of Shelly and Blanchot], recognize a “logic” that would enable us to read everything, in L’arrêt de mort and elsewhere, down to smallest grain of sand, letter [cf. GLAS p. 208r metal teeth reading machine] > a wager: I feel both the impossibility and possibility, each equally essential (same wager as translation w/out remnant)
LOBL.linkedContent: temptation of exhaustive reading [of Shelly and Blanchot], recognize a “logic” that would enable us to read everything, in L’arrêt de mort and elsewhere, down to smallest grain of sand, letter [cf. GLAS p. 208r metal teeth reading machine] > a wager: I feel both the impossibility and possibility, each equally essential (same wager as translation w/out remnant)

LOBL.content: all interdictions of pas, its double bind and invagination, make it possible to read the unreadability of impossible event, (the after-life of resurrection) of this “news”
LOBL.linkedContent: all interdictions of pas, its double bind and invagination, make it possible to read the unreadability of impossible event, (the after-life of resurrection) of this “news”

LOBL.content: the violence of leaving a text alone, “one should refrain from” as law of text, qui se donne à lire, matched by another violence, exerted against first law in an attempt to commit to it, to draw close > violent truth of “reading” [don’t touch, shred to pieces]
LOBL.linkedContent: the violence of leaving a text alone, “one should refrain from” as law of text, qui se donne à lire, matched by another violence, exerted against first law in an attempt to commit to it, to draw close > violent truth of “reading” [don’t touch, shred to pieces]

LOBL.content: absolute crypt [heart] is unreadability—yet calls for infinite finite analysis, infinite-finite reada-translata-bility
LOBL.linkedContent: absolute crypt [heart] is unreadability—yet calls for infinite finite analysis, infinite-finite reada-translata-bility

LOBL.content: how do we let a text live? letting someone read is like letting them live [re: Derrida pointing us toward Blanchot]
LOBL.linkedContent: how do we let a text live? letting someone read is like letting them live [re: Derrida pointing us toward Blanchot]

SPOM.content: is an ingenuous reading of Marx possible? when one must go beyond the first glance, when “one must see” what doesn’t let itself be seen > what sight first misses is the invisible
SPOM.linkedContent: is an ingenuous reading of Marx possible? when one must go beyond the first glance, when “one must see” what doesn’t let itself be seen > what sight first misses is the invisible

POOF.content: no testament w/out possibility of philological sidetracking (d’un mauvais aiguillage) > testament is read, offers itself (se donne) to readings, but also ordains (ordonne) readership: testament is Bible of hermeneutics
POOF.linkedContent: no testament w/out possibility of philological sidetracking (d’un mauvais aiguillage) > testament is read, offers itself (se donne) to readings, but also ordains (ordonne) readership: testament is Bible of hermeneutics

POOF.content: who invites you to read a book? i.e. to invite the word of another into your home? how many of you are there? the rejoinder, the attention promised, remains virtual
POOF.linkedContent: who invites you to read a book? i.e. to invite the word of another into your home? how many of you are there? the rejoinder, the attention promised, remains virtual

MPM.content: [see p. 88n at what speed ought one to read?] motif of precipitousness in de Man, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null, touches the sublime)
MPM.linkedContent: [see p. 88n at what speed ought one to read?] motif of precipitousness in de Man, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null, touches the sublime)

MPM.content: Pascal says don’t read too fast or slow—find a rhythm (accelerate toward rhythm)
MPM.linkedContent: Pascal says don’t read too fast or slow—find a rhythm (accelerate toward rhythm)

MPM.content: “allegory of unreadability”: when performative cannot be distinguished from constative, while still irreducible
MPM.linkedContent: “allegory of unreadability”: when performative cannot be distinguished from constative, while still irreducible

MPM.content: for De Man, we all write, like Rousseau, w/in the “misleading” of the Versprechen, which nevertheless “conveys the promise of its own truth”
MPM.linkedContent: for De Man, we all write, like Rousseau, w/in the “misleading” of the Versprechen, which nevertheless “conveys the promise of its own truth”

MPM.content: every reading engaged in a promise w/in scene of a signature/writing
MPM.linkedContent: every reading engaged in a promise w/in scene of a signature/writing

MPM.content: apparent contradiction btwn act of reading and unreadability in the act > versprechen, promise at origin of history
MPM.linkedContent: apparent contradiction btwn act of reading and unreadability in the act > versprechen, promise at origin of history

MPM.content: every reading is writing (but we must demonstrate it, following structure of promise)
MPM.linkedContent: every reading is writing (but we must demonstrate it, following structure of promise)

POO.content: in syntax of “X: A Critical Reader,” who’s reading whom, who’s the subject?
POO.linkedContent: in syntax of “X: A Critical Reader,” who’s reading whom, who’s the subject?

EM.content: Dasein serves as exemplary text to read Being [chapter title: “Nous Lisant” pp. 123-36]
EM.linkedContent: Dasein serves as exemplary text to read Being [chapter title: “Nous Lisant” pp. 123-36]

SEC.content: writing not structurally legible (iterable) beyond death of addressee wouldn’t be writing
SEC.linkedContent: writing not structurally legible (iterable) beyond death of addressee wouldn’t be writing

SEC.content: for Derrida, for a signature to function, to be legible, it must detach itself from present and singular intention of its production; its sameness alters its identity and singularity, dividing the seal [see LI pp. 30-1]
SEC.linkedContent: for Derrida, for a signature to function, to be legible, it must detach itself from present and singular intention of its production; its sameness alters its identity and singularity, dividing the seal [see LI pp. 30-1]

PP.content: cutting trace (la trace coupante): the decision of each reading, risk getting fingers caught, only chance, must not only look but touch the text
PP.linkedContent: cutting trace (la trace coupante): the decision of each reading, risk getting fingers caught, only chance, must not only look but touch the text

PP.content: ajouter n’est pas ici autre chose que donner à lire, adding thread (fil), follow thread, find hidden thread, one adds nothing by following “methodological prudence,” “norms of objectivity,” or “safeguards (garde-fous) of knowledge”
PP.linkedContent: ajouter n’est pas ici autre chose que donner à lire, adding thread (fil), follow thread, find hidden thread, one adds nothing by following “methodological prudence,” “norms of objectivity,” or “safeguards (garde-fous) of knowledge”

PP.content: reading is writing, a single gesture, but doubled, le est qui accouple la lecture à l’écriture doit en découdre
PP.linkedContent: reading is writing, a single gesture, but doubled, le est qui accouple la lecture à l’écriture doit en découdre

OH.content: via Valéry, people who read are responsible for, respond before, turn memory into “solid value,” create an absolute surplus value, increase of universal capital, “world’s wealth” increases
OH.linkedContent: via Valéry, people who read are responsible for, respond before, turn memory into “solid value,” create an absolute surplus value, increase of universal capital, “world’s wealth” increases

OH.content: Kafka, Joyce, Proust, Nietzsche were saved by a handful of readers—but what readers! [re: possible oversight of great media machines of today]
OH.linkedContent: Kafka, Joyce, Proust, Nietzsche were saved by a handful of readers—but what readers! [re: possible oversight of great media machines of today]

S.content: Dasein is exemplary because of the experience of the question; privileged entity for a reading of Being
S.linkedContent: Dasein is exemplary because of the experience of the question; privileged entity for a reading of Being

SH.content: readability effaces the date, the very thing which it offers for reading, date must conceal w/in itself stigma of singularity if it is to last longer (lasting is the poem), only chance of spectral return, commemoration of date’s annihilation, kind of nothing or ash > ash awaits us
SH.linkedContent: readability effaces the date, the very thing which it offers for reading, date must conceal w/in itself stigma of singularity if it is to last longer (lasting is the poem), only chance of spectral return, commemoration of date’s annihilation, kind of nothing or ash > ash awaits us

SH.content: ellipsis & caesura of discretion [Blanchot] inhabit the shibboleth (Joyce), it fascinates, seduces ——shibboleth as the cipher of the cipher: ciphered manifestation of the cipher, emerges from nonmeaning, and keeps itself in reserve
SH.linkedContent: ellipsis & caesura of discretion [Blanchot] inhabit the shibboleth (Joyce), it fascinates, seduces ——shibboleth as the cipher of the cipher: ciphered manifestation of the cipher, emerges from nonmeaning, and keeps itself in reserve

SH.content: cipher can conceal secret, which it shelters in its readability, w/out the slightest hidden attention > there’s nothing it can do about it [why/who interpret(s) secret as a taunting gesture?]
SH.linkedContent: cipher can conceal secret, which it shelters in its readability, w/out the slightest hidden attention > there’s nothing it can do about it [why/who interpret(s) secret as a taunting gesture?]

SH.content: name partakes in this destiny of ash along w/ date, not empirical, is part of its readability
SH.linkedContent: name partakes in this destiny of ash along w/ date, not empirical, is part of its readability

SH.content: mourning: reading itself > readability: tribute of lost singularity (“beauty” pays)
SH.linkedContent: mourning: reading itself > readability: tribute of lost singularity (“beauty” pays)

SH.content: “Sie setzt / Wundgelesens über (it carries across / the wound-read)”: [circumcision in the reading] “reader-gatherer” > wound offers itself to be read—not readable, but a part of reading
SH.linkedContent: “Sie setzt / Wundgelesens über (it carries across / the wound-read)”: [circumcision in the reading] “reader-gatherer” > wound offers itself to be read—not readable, but a part of reading

SH.content: wound, very experience of reading, universal

F.content: “in you, anonymous reader in this much-sealed case”
F.linkedContent: “in you, anonymous reader in this much-sealed case”

DS.content: out of sight (a perte de vue): hymen & dissemination > une entaille y est marquée, qui ouvre encore sur un autre texte et pratique une autre lecture, l’analyse en serait infinie
DS.linkedContent: out of sight (a perte de vue): hymen & dissemination > une entaille y est marquée, qui ouvre encore sur un autre texte et pratique une autre lecture, l’analyse en serait infinie

DS.content: “event” (historical event, if you wish) has form of a repetition, the mark (readable because doubled) of a quasi-tearing (quasi-déchirure), a dehiscence [etymology of dehiscence follows]
DS.linkedContent: “event” (historical event, if you wish) has form of a repetition, the mark (readable because doubled) of a quasi-tearing (quasi-déchirure), a dehiscence [etymology of dehiscence follows]

DS.content: mime mimes a kind of writing, is himself written in a kind of writing, nothing of what is can lie beyond medium/speculum reading-writing > there is 1) writing w/out book, marking tip (la pointe du trait) proceeds w/out past upon virgin sheet 2) infinite number of booklets in other booklets > Mallarmé reads, writes while reading, while reading text written by Mime, who himself reads in order to write
DS.linkedContent: mime mimes a kind of writing, is himself written in a kind of writing, nothing of what is can lie beyond medium/speculum reading-writing > there is 1) writing w/out book, marking tip (la pointe du trait) proceeds w/out past upon virgin sheet 2) infinite number of booklets in other booklets > Mallarmé reads, writes while reading, while reading text written by Mime, who himself reads in order to write

DS.content: in the morgue you’ve been able to read the folding (vous aurez pu lire que la pliure)
DS.linkedContent: in the morgue you’ve been able to read the folding (vous aurez pu lire que la pliure)

DS.content: “themes” run aground (échoue) at edge lesser & greater than theme, where “there is” a text is made a possibility, a readability w/out signified (fright’s reflex declares: unreadable)
DS.linkedContent: “themes” run aground (échoue) at edge lesser & greater than theme, where “there is” a text is made a possibility, a readability w/out signified (fright’s reflex declares: unreadable)

DS.content: a bo/lit [TN. abolishing: reading, sleeping]: la dissémination y écume assez le vol d’une semence, perte blanche et vaine où le mât, pour qui le lit, s’abîme en perdition de voile et d’enfant
DS.linkedContent: a bo/lit [TN. abolishing: reading, sleeping]: la dissémination y écume assez le vol d’une semence, perte blanche et vaine où le mât, pour qui le lit, s’abîme en perdition de voile et d’enfant

POS.content: reading is transformational, yet to find a suitable protocol for reading [re: Marx]
POS.linkedContent: reading is transformational, yet to find a suitable protocol for reading [re: Marx]

POS.content: “I read while writing: slowly, taking pleasure in long prefaces to each term”
POS.linkedContent: “I read while writing: slowly, taking pleasure in long prefaces to each term”

PS.content: [reading as theft] because its forethought cannot be predicted, the act of reading perforates act of speaking & writing > through this hole, perforation, I escape myself
PS.linkedContent: [reading as theft] because its forethought cannot be predicted, the act of reading perforates act of speaking & writing > through this hole, perforation, I escape myself

PS.content: Nietzsche: “I hate the reading idlers. / He who knoweth the reader, doeth nothing more for the reader. Another century of readers—and spirit itself will stink.”
PS.linkedContent: Nietzsche: “I hate the reading idlers. / He who knoweth the reader, doeth nothing more for the reader. Another century of readers—and spirit itself will stink.”

FS.content: God imprints secondarity on every navigation of the human: 1) passage of deferred reciprocity btwn reading & writing? 2) absolute witness who’s already read what you will write: third party as transparency of meaning? [circular logos]
FS.linkedContent: God imprints secondarity on every navigation of the human: 1) passage of deferred reciprocity btwn reading & writing? 2) absolute witness who’s already read what you will write: third party as transparency of meaning? [circular logos]

SW.content: I do not foresee the future thus promised, I foretell it
SW.linkedContent: I do not foresee the future thus promised, I foretell it

SW.content: the gage of my foretelling destines: calls to make come, beyond any truth of ontological revelation
SW.linkedContent: the gage of my foretelling destines: calls to make come, beyond any truth of ontological revelation

SW.content: it destines itself to those men & women who will know how to read, of course—knowing how to read (voilà, the circle) only on basis of gage given > reading finally what you have to read
SW.linkedContent: it destines itself to those men & women who will know how to read, of course—knowing how to read (voilà, the circle) only on basis of gage given > reading finally what you have to read

SW.content: [to read the corpus that has known, from operation of other, how to undo itself from veiling/unveiling] you have to write, sign in turn, countersign in writing, something else, in another language, w/out betraying injection/call of first seal
SW.linkedContent: [to read the corpus that has known, from operation of other, how to undo itself from veiling/unveiling] you have to write, sign in turn, countersign in writing, something else, in another language, w/out betraying injection/call of first seal

SW.content: can’t prove it happened, only swear that it did: perjury must remain possible (a duty that must be respected)
SW.linkedContent: can’t prove it happened, only swear that it did: perjury must remain possible (a duty that must be respected)

RGE.content: a text [Bataille’s] that traces, in silence, structure of the eye [illumination] > in contriving/weaving (tramer) “l’absolu déchirement,” absolutely rends (déchire) its own tissue—once more “solid” and servile de se donner encore à lire
RGE.linkedContent: a text [Bataille’s] that traces, in silence, structure of the eye [illumination] > in contriving/weaving (tramer) “l’absolu déchirement,” absolutely rends (déchire) its own tissue—once more “solid” and servile de se donner encore à lire

DST.content: “one must read, and to do this one must come to terms, negotiate, compromise”
DST.linkedContent: “one must read, and to do this one must come to terms, negotiate, compromise”

DST.content: resistance indicates sensitive point (lieu sensible) in a reading > point (point) of incomprehension that organizes it
DST.linkedContent: resistance indicates sensitive point (lieu sensible) in a reading > point (point) of incomprehension that organizes it

RM.content: every reading is btwn tropic capacities (not literal on one side & figurative on the other)
RM.linkedContent: every reading is btwn tropic capacities (not literal on one side & figurative on the other)

PF.content: reading: legare (distance, delegate) & legere (gather, collecting) [same etymology as law?], as [reading] ties together, it gives rise, out of fidelity, to dispersion, referral & send off, allegation > figures that risk proliferating alibis
PF.linkedContent: reading: legare (distance, delegate) & legere (gather, collecting) [same etymology as law?], as [reading] ties together, it gives rise, out of fidelity, to dispersion, referral & send off, allegation > figures that risk proliferating alibis

PF.content: decision supposes passage through undecidable of a crisis/krinein/krisis (choice of election, selection: legere, lecture/reading)
PF.linkedContent: decision supposes passage through undecidable of a crisis/krinein/krisis (choice of election, selection: legere, lecture/reading)

PF.content: a work worthy of the name always opens a virtual university, appeals to a new universal knowledge capable of “reading” it, countersigning it, assuring its tradition
PF.linkedContent: a work worthy of the name always opens a virtual university, appeals to a new universal knowledge capable of “reading” it, countersigning it, assuring its tradition

TR.content: reader as judge, the addressee who decides on reception/address of post card, signature left to the responsibility of the other, reader signs at moment of arrival at destination, rather than at the origin, at moment of reading rather than of writing
TR.linkedContent: reader as judge, the addressee who decides on reception/address of post card, signature left to the responsibility of the other, reader signs at moment of arrival at destination, rather than at the origin, at moment of reading rather than of writing

TR.content: Rousseau’s interest in justice of inheritance/reading: responsible countersignature
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau’s interest in justice of inheritance/reading: responsible countersignature

WAP.content: even among people who read me “effects of interpretation are very unequal,” these differences are irreducible
WAP.linkedContent: even among people who read me “effects of interpretation are very unequal,” these differences are irreducible

WAP.content: those who think reading is immediately to do, and those who think reading is not to do, not even to write: both caught in oppositional conceptual guardrails (garde-fous)
WAP.linkedContent: those who think reading is immediately to do, and those who think reading is not to do, not even to write: both caught in oppositional conceptual guardrails (garde-fous)

PJP.content: maddening irregularity of anacoluthon: dispersal/disavowal of “you,” “us,” where is the reader, the supposed addressees?
PJP.linkedContent: maddening irregularity of anacoluthon: dispersal/disavowal of “you,” “us,” where is the reader, the supposed addressees?

D.content: Soller’s Numbers is exemplary re: the reader, cette fois enfin, the text shows (montrée) that a reader cannot choose his/her place in a text > does so by composing surfaces retournées & par une mise en scène matérielle exacte
D.linkedContent: Soller’s Numbers is exemplary re: the reader, cette fois enfin, the text shows (montrée) that a reader cannot choose his/her place in a text > does so by composing surfaces retournées & par une mise en scène matérielle exacte

EL.content: edge (bord) of this reading, as on edge of “those abysses of abysses”
EL.linkedContent: edge (bord) of this reading, as on edge of “those abysses of abysses”

LI.content: Derrida’s relation to reader: neither has the means nor desire to consult the reader re: interruption of reading, but haven’t I imparted reason on him & good faith? > forever in doubt
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s relation to reader: neither has the means nor desire to consult the reader re: interruption of reading, but haven’t I imparted reason on him & good faith? > forever in doubt

LI.content: reconstitution of context can never be perfect but is a regulative ideal of an ethics of reading: recalling of a context never neutral, innocent, transparent, disinterested
LI.linkedContent: reconstitution of context can never be perfect but is a regulative ideal of an ethics of reading: recalling of a context never neutral, innocent, transparent, disinterested

TN.content: [Nancy beautifully describes minimally deferred contact, promise of contact in reading]
TN.linkedContent: [Nancy beautifully describes minimally deferred contact, promise of contact in reading]

CIN.content: [on structure of CIN] graphic space opened to multiple readings—in traditional, protected form of book
CIN.linkedContent: [on structure of CIN] graphic space opened to multiple readings—in traditional, protected form of book

CIN.content: each time it gives a different reading, another gift, dealing out a new hand all over again
CIN.linkedContent: each time it gives a different reading, another gift, dealing out a new hand all over again

BSi.content: Rousseau confesses: I lived like a werewolf (loup-garou) (outlaw, savage) because I read
BSi.linkedContent: Rousseau confesses: I lived like a werewolf (loup-garou) (outlaw, savage) because I read

BSi.content: not reading: neglect (neglego, neglegere), not gathering (legere), not electing (élire) [one doesn’t have to neglect the book to neglect to read]
BSi.linkedContent: not reading: neglect (neglego, neglegere), not gathering (legere), not electing (élire) [one doesn’t have to neglect the book to neglect to read]

OG.content: surface of page distributes itself differently depending on whether one is reading or writing (writing sensible/ reading intelligible > but, opposition disqualified: it’s impossible to purely separate writing/reading), coordination of hand/eye > that phoné must see itself, handle itself, in temporal linearity, this is only one way of speech [i.e. ethnocentric universalism]
OG.linkedContent: surface of page distributes itself differently depending on whether one is reading or writing (writing sensible/ reading intelligible > but, opposition disqualified: it’s impossible to purely separate writing/reading), coordination of hand/eye > that phoné must see itself, handle itself, in temporal linearity, this is only one way of speech [i.e. ethnocentric universalism]

OG.content: [Derrida is questioning very space of page, its determination by movement of hand, linearity, wonders about abandonment of boustrophedon, turning of the ox, writing by furrows > linear, phonographic techniques homogenize space—age of transaction?] [baby daddy]
OG.linkedContent: [Derrida is questioning very space of page, its determination by movement of hand, linearity, wonders about abandonment of boustrophedon, turning of the ox, writing by furrows > linear, phonographic techniques homogenize space—age of transaction?] [baby daddy]

OG.content: Rousseau: “I have always had a fancy for eating while reading”
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: “I have always had a fancy for eating while reading”

ATAP.content: John Patmos (1: 2–3) “the joys of the reader, of the hearer/of the words of the inspiration/for those who keep what is written/yes, the time approaches”: angelic structure, condition of all marks, time, experience, writing, trace > “apocalyptic” writings: exemplary revelation of this transcendental structure
ATAP.linkedContent: John Patmos (1: 2–3) “the joys of the reader, of the hearer/of the words of the inspiration/for those who keep what is written/yes, the time approaches”: angelic structure, condition of all marks, time, experience, writing, trace > “apocalyptic” writings: exemplary revelation of this transcendental structure

ATAP.content: do not know to whom apocalyptic envoi returns, perhaps not even man is the terminal of this computer w/out end
ATAP.linkedContent: do not know to whom apocalyptic envoi returns, perhaps not even man is the terminal of this computer w/out end

CIR.content: desire for literature is circumcision, text read does not suffice, has to be eaten, sucked
CIR.linkedContent: desire for literature is circumcision, text read does not suffice, has to be eaten, sucked

SPEC.content: curtains, veils, “skirt” of bed, hymen of fort:da, edge of bed (lit) [of reading?], va-et-vient, there would’ve been a hymen even w/out curtains > veil of this “skirt” is interest of bed (lit) and fort:da of all these generations
SPEC.linkedContent: curtains, veils, “skirt” of bed, hymen of fort:da, edge of bed (lit) [of reading?], va-et-vient, there would’ve been a hymen even w/out curtains > veil of this “skirt” is interest of bed (lit) and fort:da of all these generations

SPEC.content: [Derrida clearly explains the difference btwn fort/da and fort:da] “skirt” of bed, which hides the bars, forms inner chamber of fort/da, double screen which divides w/in itself—but dividing only by reassembling it w/ itself, sticking (piquant) to itself doubly, fort:da
SPEC.linkedContent: [Derrida clearly explains the difference btwn fort/da and fort:da] “skirt” of bed, which hides the bars, forms inner chamber of fort/da, double screen which divides w/in itself—but dividing only by reassembling it w/ itself, sticking (piquant) to itself doubly, fort:da

SPEC.content: skepsis, maieutics [in Freud]—division btwn differance & opposition marked in Philebus (12E) > Beyond… in turn becoming supplementary chapter of Philebus, Philebus deciphers it from afar like a teleguided reading device, Philebus reads Beyond…, is lodged in it > this setting adrift is programmed by discourse on apeiron: Socrates’ last word of Philebus: “let go”
SPEC.linkedContent: skepsis, maieutics [in Freud]—division btwn differance & opposition marked in Philebus (12E) > Beyond… in turn becoming supplementary chapter of Philebus, Philebus deciphers it from afar like a teleguided reading device, Philebus reads Beyond…, is lodged in it > this setting adrift is programmed by discourse on apeiron: Socrates’ last word of Philebus: “let go”

FV.content: [profiting from remnant] by means of a remnant of paternal inheritance, one the debtors left out of account, Dupin draws revenue, surplus-value of a capital that works by itself, calculating (rigorous economy) > Dupin can pay for a sole luxury [Dupin’s desire to read]: cuts across restricted economy like gift w/out return

FV.content: reading [for narrator of Purloined…], treasure w/out price
